item.description:
This film is part of the Jewish Film Festival playing March 13-23, 2010.

Herzl is a 340 lb chef who lives with his mother, is fed up with rigid diet regimes and abusive weight loss clubs. Just as he and his overweight buddies seem beaten down, Herzl meeets Kitano, a Sushi restaurant owner, and discovers the one place where big guys can become rock stars: Japanese sumo wrestling. This endearing and poignant comdey traces their tender and funny paths from body shame to body celebration, from lonliness to love. Rich in belly laughs, A Matter of Size tops the scales with its plus-sized heart.
Winner of 4 2009 Ophir Awards, Israeli Film and Television Academy
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the lobby about 8:10 sitting at a table.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: A Matter of Size
